website_summaries.verdict: Optimal shoe-filling design and top-notch construction make these shoe trees the only choice for consumers who want the best.
pros: Top construction by a manufacturer known for making quality wood products
Made of solid cedar with rugged steel hardware
Fills shoe precisely to maintain shape
cons: Very tight spring makes tree slightly challenging to remove from some shoes
This is a small concern given the top quality

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a great shoe tree!
customer_reviews.text: The shoe tree is great, but I wish the sizing chart on the back of the box was in the description. Based on shoe size, I got and XL, but based on width, I should have gotten a large. That's why I took a star off. I took a pic of the back of the box for the men's size and width so you can get (hopefully) the right size on the first shot.
customer_reviews.author: Sleepers Delight

customer_reviews.title: Goes IN the shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I done bought five of these. I wish the heel were a little wider. It's narrow enough it kind of jabs the back of the shoe. But if it's good enough for Allen Edmonds then by the gods old and new it's good enough for me. They're handmade, so the R and L will be slightly different in size and shape, but close enough. I also wish there was a little knob on top instead of the loop of string. Maybe I should give them four stars. Inner turmoil. Life is hard.
customer_reviews.author: kitano

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Cedar Shoe Tree
customer_reviews.text: Perfect Shoe horns. PROS: 1. Highly moisture absorbent 2. Nice Cedar Smell 3. Well Constructed 4. Medium fits excellent in my Size 9 Shoes 5. Strong Sturdy Feel 6. Shaped perfectly for my dress loafer shoes 7. Very reasonably priced at $20.00 CONS: 1. Maybe could use a metal knob on heel part to push and release but then it wouldn't be $20. The Green pull string works fine. Very happy with purchase. I have bought 8 pairs for my shoes. It really does keep this in shape by pulling out the moisture and giving the shoe back it's shape for the next use.
customer_reviews.author: Wise Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended, great for polishing!
customer_reviews.text: I've never had shoe trees before but recently got a job where I had to travel with packed dress shoes a lot. This lead to my dress shoes being squished and deformed fairly quickly. After seeing a coworker pull these or of these shoes o had to give them a try. They turned out to be perfect. I looked up the size chart, bought the appropriate model and put them in my shoe. When I pushed in the back the spring loaded toes expanded leaving the shoes nice and stiff. As an added bonus the small back piece made a nice handles for holding when I polished them for the first time!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Brandman

customer_reviews.title: Good AE shoe tree
customer_reviews.text: Bought the large for men's 11 dress shoes in standard D width. Wish I had gone with the XL. I do like these, but I like them to fit tighter in my shoes to keep the creases to a minimum. The pull loops are a nice touch to remove them from your shoes. These run about the same price as most cedar shoe trees on Amz so if you're an AE fanboi these won't disappoint. FYI these do ooze a bit of sap, which can happen with cedar shoe trees so don't grab them then wipe your hands on your favorite dress shirt. I'll buy more, but at the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Functions great, I do have some feedback on that metal logo plate however...
customer_reviews.text: It functions perfectly, and does the job. The wood is handsome and I love the aesthetic - except I'm not a huge fan of the metal plate with printed logo. A smaller metal plate, with stamped (physically imprinted) lettering would have been much more classic and appealing. I love my shoes and take pride in my choices, and the maintenance and want the shoe trees to meet that standard. But at the end of the day they are quality shoe trees for a fair price and they get the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: OK for the price; sharp edges
customer_reviews.text: At About $17.00 a pair, I cannot complain a great deal. All of the edges are rather sharp, and so I took a little sandpaper to break them. Fortunately, the cedar wood is very soft and unfinished, so about five minutes' work was all I needed to smooth off those edges. I do believe that this was time well-invested, as the sharp edges could possibly damage the shoe leather. Also, one of the supports in the heel portion of the shoe tree was cracked. I repaired that with epoxy, but believe that this defective tree should have been caught by quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Bridge

customer_reviews.title: I do not like this design
customer_reviews.text: I ordered according to my size and they will fit in my shoes, however when the heel is pressed forward the toes spread out and there is no adjustment so I cannot use these for my leather shoes.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: They are now mine!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my husband whose feet seem to have expanded over the last year so his work boots were starting to squeeze the ever living life out of his poor feet. Long story short, these stretched his boots enough that they would feel alright for the first couple hours of his work day, but felt tight again by the end of his shift. Also, unless he made sure to put them in every single day, his boots would be snug on his feet. I know these are not some miracle cure, and are not actual shoe stretchers, so I confiscated them for my boots and just made him buy wide width boots! haha.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. First shoe tree I've every bought. I noticed that my one pair of nice dress shoes (about 3 years old, never in a tree shoe) was buckling at the vamp (top of forefoot) and the toe was starting to point up, creating majors wrinkles and creases. Love the heavy spring loaded, split forefoot section allowing the shoe tree to conform very well to the shoe. The springs are very strong along the heel portion as well. Hopefully with some good shoe cream I can work out some of the creases. If I had more dress shoe I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe trees
customer_reviews.text: Shoe trees always seemed like a luxury item to me. I have owned a few pairs of cheap plastic ones, but the fit as alway iffy and they ended up being too much trouble. These fit in the shoe perfectly are spring loaded so there's no adjustment, and they keep my shoes in much better shape. If you own any nice leather shoes, this will keep them nice longer. I wish I'd bought them sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Alfie

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not manually adjustable
customer_reviews.text: These trees are not manually adjustable. They are adjustable in the sense that they swivel to align with the sides of the shoe, but the amount of pressure they exert on the shoe sides is a fixed function of the spring. If you want more pressure, as in when you want to widen the shoe, you will have to place a shim behind the heel or between the two front halves of the tree. Other than that they are well designed and made. Overall I'm happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: and overall extremely poor quality. They feel like cheap wood
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because I was content with the set I previously bought - this was not a repeat feeling. As I pulled them out of the box, there were 5 slivers of wood poking out of them, one has a large knot right in the middle, and overall extremely poor quality. They feel like cheap wood, look like cheap wood, and are nothing close to what I previously purchased. Also, using the sizing chart provided by Woodlore, they also seem larger than what the shoe needs (for a 10 wide ordered a large). Very very very disappointing purchase - strongly suggest different brand and not wasting your money on woodlore.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: very nice low cost shoe tree by well known manufacturer.
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made "starter" shoe tree for great price. I thought they were too big until I read a blog showing that you have to push the toe into the shoe BEFORE you push the heel and spread the toe. Works like and charm and these fit my cap toe oxfords very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: They fit great, do the job they were built to do
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoe trees since my other pair—different manufacturer with a different toe split design—have been yanking out part of my shoes. They fit great, do the job they were built to do, and do not damage my shoes. The only reason I'm giving a 4/5 is because the spring bar along the center is sticky which seems odd.
customer_reviews.author: Rory

customer_reviews.title: Cedar is the way to go
customer_reviews.text: These are great. You don't need anything better. Maybe you do, but then again you are you. And you are never happy. Nothing ever really pleases you and I bet you still have some reserves about the quality of your Edward Green collection. For the price you would expect to see higher stitching detail. And when posting to Ask Andy you never cease to understand why anyone would wear anything but the best. Isn't it obvious? Because they're not you. Only you can have the best. If everyone else could have the best, then what would be the point in having it? Well then; it's settled. I think you better get the more 'refined' shoe trees.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: nice quality
customer_reviews.text: these are very nice quality + have a great cedar smell + are just as nice as the more expensive Florsheim shoe trees! I wear a sixe "13" and I ordered size XL but they were short in legnth about an inch in the toe, I contacted the supplier "Leather Care Supply" and they shipped a replacement pair in XXL that fit perfect, They also sent a postage paid return label + I was so delighted with their Super Customer Service!!! 5 star product + 5 stars for Leather Care Supplier"!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: BobG

customer_reviews.title: they work just fine. Just pop 'em into a good pair of ...
customer_reviews.text: Umm, this is a shoe tree, not a shoe. So the questions about comfort don't really apply. But hey, as shoe trees, they work just fine. Just pop 'em into a good pair of dress shoes, and the shoes hold their shape. If you're a grownup and you're spending over $100 for a pair of leather shoes that fit your feet, these are a great investment. The cedar helps absorb that narsty foot aroma. If you scuff the cedar with fine sandpaper every year or so, the cedar smell is re-released nicely. I have about 4 pairs of these and like them just fine. Good price, too.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H.

customer_reviews.title: Quality - Purchased Multiple Times
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first Woodlore Tree about two years ago when I noticed that the toe box on my expensive dress shoes was starting to wrinkle. The Woodlore Tree corrected the problem and have extended the life of the shoes considerably. I have purchased additional trees for subsequent shoe purchases and, in comparing the newly purchased trees to the tree first purchased two years ago, I am impressed by how well the original tree had held up. I expect these trees to last for many years and will most certainly purchase additional Woodlore trees in the future. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Greiner

customer_reviews.title: Works better than many others I have tried.
customer_reviews.text: I was actually using another brand that I thought was as good as it gets. This actually has a strong cedar smell which is exactly what I want. Smells like the inside of my Taylor guitar. I like the rope on top which makes pulling it out easier. The other brand I used came with sandpaper blocks which was a good idea but still didn't have the nice smell of cedar like these do. I will get more. Thanks Woodlore.
customer_reviews.author: Fsuholley

customer_reviews.title: Need a women-specific version!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice quality adjustable shoe trees. The toe block is too hefty for women's heels and pumps of the same size. I use it for my lace-up leather boots and they fit nicely though a little tight. It's most likely because these shoe trees are meant for men and not women. A women's version would be great!
customer_reviews.author: Jane L.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed and a fantastic product for the price. They fit my shoes well and you may have to finagle the shoe tree a bit to get it to completely fill out your shoe. Past reviewers who commented that the shoe tree does not fill their shoe completely are not properly placing the tree into the shoe. You do have to jiggle it around a bit at times, but it will fill the full shoe. TL, DR: Fits my shoe great, solid build, keeps my shoes' sweat free, well structured, and smelling fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Great way to preserve dress shoes; Every man needs a pair
customer_reviews.text: If you have dress shoes, you need these. Pros: - They're cedar, which means they'll absorb smells and they won't mess up your shoes - Tired of your dress shoes with ugly "stretch marks" where your toes bend? These help with that. - They help keep your dress shoes straight. After multiple wears, your dress shoes will start bending like it is being exorcised. These help. Cons: - I started noticing that some rough edges were chipping and leaving behind small pieces in the shoe. (Remedy: Check your shoes and try to pick off the chipped wood from the shoe tree)
customer_reviews.author: Monsoon

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I've recently decided to take better care of my investment in my more expensive dress footwear, so I ordered 2 pairs of these Woodlore brand shoe trees, which are manufactured by the Allen Edmonds Shoe Co., an ultra-elite American men's footwear manufacturer. When I received them, I compared them to a set of shoe trees that I picked up at DSW, and their superior quality was immediately evident. They cost about $5 per pair more than the cheap set (not including shipping costs), but, in this case, you get what you pay for! I intend to buy more of these from time-to-time, until I have them in all eleven pairs of my dress shoes.
customer_reviews.author: prbart140

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, as it really helps to take out the moisture in my shoes and helps keep them in the same shape. They go in easy, are easily adjustable with the automatic spring, and come out super easy. It really leaves a nice smell when you remove them. When the smell of the cedar isnt as strong anymore I simply sand them down lightly and poof! The nice cedar smell is back. Get them, you wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Too large
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a size 12D pair of shoes and it fit very well. Except the shoes were too big so I exchanged them for 11.5D, the lower end of the scale for these shoe trees. While the shoe tree width was still ok in the smaller shoes, they barely squeezed into them lengthwise. I couldn't see myself struggling with these trees on a daily basis and was concerned they might damage the shoes. The large ones of this brand supposedly only go up to size 11 so I switched to a different brand of shoe trees to avoid another potential issue. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: V. Vanderbent

customer_reviews.title: quality item
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my son who has been trying to find a good quality shoe tree for his better shoes. This is just what he wanted, much better quality than the plastic ones he had seen
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality Shoe Tree
customer_reviews.text: I have owned leather shoes before, but never purchased a shoe tree until this last pair of shoes, but I will definitely be purchasing more in the future. I have owned the Wodlore Adjustable Men's Shoe Tree for three months and have had no regrets whatsoever from this purchase. They are simple to use, keep my dress shoes in good form, and reduce odor. As an added bonus, these make it especially easy to clean your shoes as well. In terms of the price and quality, I do not feel this product can be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley O.

customer_reviews.title: A very fine shoe tree
customer_reviews.text: For starters, I have had two pairs of these shoe trees for over a year now and will continue to buy these whenever I need additional pairs. I judge staple items like these based on two criteria: do they do what they are meant to, and how long can I expect them to continue doing so. This product meets both to a very satisfactory degree. There's nothing fancy about these, solid cedar and solid construction. Mine have been in and out of several pairs and shoes and show no evidence of giving in or losing their spring. Recommended for anyone looking for a no frills and functional product.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel W.

customer_reviews.title: A great buy!
customer_reviews.text: These are so high quality that they could easily be double the price. I think these could likely last me a lifetime and they keep my leather shoes looking brand new every time I wear them. A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: butler_ke

customer_reviews.title: stays firm and nice in your shoe and keeps your boots in its ...
customer_reviews.text: Does it's job at sucking the nasty moistures left in your boots after a day of wearing 'em. stays firm and nice in your shoe and keeps your boots in its optimal form and condition. I gave it 4 star instead of 5 because it came a bit dusty with wood-dust particles. I grabbed a wet paper towel and wiped the general surfaces and they were fine to use after. P.S. the little pull-up knot of this shoetree was more convenient than i thought. It saves few seconds when you're in a hurry and need to equip your boots.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Great! Fights Odor, Too!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE the design and scent of these. I was soooooo pleasantly surprised when I received my first one. They're truly a rich, all-natural cedar! The only downside is that they seem a tad large to me. They didn't fit into some of my smaller shoes. (Though, they fit fine in some of my larger shoes, so maybe I'm just a freak.) I ended up ordering an additional one in the smaller size, and may order another – even smaller – set. I think it really depends on the design of the shoe. "One size doesn't fit all," in this case. ; )
customer_reviews.author: Joshua T. Ebert

customer_reviews.title: High quality for a good price
customer_reviews.text: These were the cheapest cedar shoe trees on Amazon and I was really pleased with the quality. They smell great and have been doing a great job restoring the shape of my shoes.
customer_reviews.author: N. Domitrovich

customer_reviews.title: Cedar Shoe Trees
customer_reviews.text: These shoe trees were made pretty well. The spring that was put in was a bit too strong for my taste. I mention this, because the back of the shoe tree is very narrow, and that puts a lot of pressure on the back of a shoe. This amount of pressure can misshapen a shoe's heel. Overall, though, it is a good shoe tree for the price. The cedar is really good, and they smell great!
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe trees to extend the life (and pleasant smell) of your footwear
customer_reviews.text: Bought these shoe trees for an expensive pair of Cole Haan's that I wear for work. I love that they're made in the US, have a great cedar smell which keeps my shoes from smelling rancid, and work perfectly to help my shoes keep their shape. I work as a DJ and spent almost $300 on my shoes so of course I want to keep them going for as long as possible and am confident that these shoe trees will do their part in making that happen. I will buy these again if I ever need to replace these for some reason or add another pair of fancy shoes to my work or play collection. Don't hesitate to buy!
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Isaacs

customer_reviews.title: Great trees - recommended.
customer_reviews.text: The trees work great - no complaints. If you've never used them before, my only tips are to make sure and use the right one for the right show...they are generally created to fit either the left or right. If you don't, you run the risk of changing the shoe profile...not a good thing. Also, if you wear leather-soled shoes, I highly recommend putting the trees in at all times, especially when the soles get wet. That helps keep the shoes from curling.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Built to last Cedar shoe tree
customer_reviews.text: One of the originals and the best. I use for shoes, boots, and sneakers alike. They’re the most versatile design. The cedar is aromatic and lasts long. When the scent is gone just lightly sand away and they’re like new.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Fit my Red Wing boots just fine!
customer_reviews.text: The medium is perfect for my Beckman's (size 9 D). It's a snug fit! I haven't had the trees long, so I can't attest to the longevity of the cedar scent, but it's been pleasant thus far. I'll definitely update, if I experience any issues.
customer_reviews.author: TonTon Suarez

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes the old way is best, and simple often trumps complicated.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those 'must have' items which have become less common. Like any maintenance product you need these. Woodlore makes just the right product, by my standards. The use of cedar it the ideal wood, and wood is what you need. Leather is organic and I don't and I've always found that it seems to do best in 'real' shoe trees. These don't require adjustment, can be renewed/refreshed with find sandpaper, actually have a 'classy' look/feel like you'll remember from the 40s and 50s (if you're old enough). At the price, they're a 'give away'.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck A.

customer_reviews.title: Made well, but doesn't help.
customer_reviews.text: I guess the set I got is too small even though I used the size chart. My brand new shoes look just as old and worn as those that are over a year old. I tested the difference by using one shoe tree on my left shoe for a couple weeks and none on the right shoe. Both look identical. Not sure if this is a true measure of the usefulness, but this was recommended to me. The only reason I gave it 2-stars is because I believe they are solidly made and operate well. I just wish they did what they were supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great for preventing creases in leather shoes - would recommend
customer_reviews.text: These fit true to size, I've been using the 11.5 - 13M size shoe tree for size twelve shoes for a couple years now. I have a pair of these for each one of my leather dress shoes and they do a great job of preventing creases. A definite must have if you've have nicer dress shoes that you'd like to last a while. One thing to note - the cedar smell fades after a few months so these wont do much to keep your shoes smelling fresh. A trivial point, but one worth mentioning.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff Rose

customer_reviews.title: I love that amazon tries to review these as actual shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love that amazon tries to review these as actual shoes. Great shoe trees! I keep them in my brown leather Cole-haans. Because of the self adjuster I feel like the shoe trees adapt well to fit the inside of the somewhat narrow endings. My shoes have somewhat pointy toes, but not an incredibly elongated ending so it works perfect. Overall I like using these and the smell isn't too bad either. Still prefer brand new leather scent, but it's nice not to stink.
customer_reviews.author: Bleach

customer_reviews.title: Fits men's US 6D size.
customer_reviews.text: I only wear boots in men's sizes, so I wasn't sure which women's sized one to get. I would not go smaller than a men's 6 though with these. Very aromatic as well.
customer_reviews.author: Red Baron X

customer_reviews.title: As-Expected. This is my second purchase of these, ...
customer_reviews.text: As-Expected. This is my second purchase of these, the second pair came marked "L" and "R"... my old pair weren't marked and I never paid much attention to notice they were specific before. Oopse.
customer_reviews.author: Brett J.

customer_reviews.title: no more elf shoes for me.
customer_reviews.text: product is good, if you think they will mock your foot girth this product is not for you but if you want your shoe to stay flat and not like the Keebler elf's than get this product because it will keep the shoe shape and make it smell like wood. so fresh!! if the smell goes away just sand it a bit with 220 grit sand paper and the smell returns.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Flores

customer_reviews.title: SPEND THE EXTRA BUCKS ON QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: THESE CEDAR TREES ARE AWESOME, AS THEY GO IN THE FRONT EXPANDS TO KEEP THE FEEL / FIT OF THE SHOE.... IF YOU WEAR SHOES THAT COST OVER $500 LIKE I DO, YOU'D BE A FOOL NOT TO INVEST IN QUALITY SHOE TREES. I almost didnt buy these cause of the price, I almost bought a cheap pair, however after feeling how these trees worked and the front expanded in the shoe, I am sure glad I spent the extra money. I will have these for life !
customer_reviews.author: Nick W

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, good price
customer_reviews.text: Shoe tree's are a must, especially after you spend an arm and a leg for some nice kicks. These do the trick and the price is right - as you probably know, cedar is one of the best materials for shoe trees, since it absorbs moisture as well as scent. These are spring-loaded, so the further you push the heel forward, the wider the front portion spreads. There's no cranking mechanism to spread the toe box area. They do the job, and it's a great way to keep your shoes looking fresh.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this item - total junk
customer_reviews.text: I have a collection of boots and quite a few boot trees This is the worst POS Binds up when trying to install - this is main purpose for it Not cool These are suppose to go into the boot and self align to the toe This thing might work for fire wood - not even sure about that Don’t do it
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This is asking me questions about how these fit... but these are shoe trees. They fit the shoes, I don't wear them.. Anyways, these are great. Fantastic quality, no cons on these at all. I keep them in my shoes from the minute I take my feet out until I put my feet back in them. Great for storing shoes and helps with my shoes and keeping their fit. If you're looking for great quality shoe trees, look no further, cause Woodlore did a great job with these. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: 4kark

customer_reviews.title: Great value, works well, I bought 5
customer_reviews.text: Bought 5 pairs. I had to get one replacement because it arrived in a bad state, seemed like a pair that was remvoed because of quality issues was mixed in with the normal pairs - it had a crack, glue, and wood chipping. Other that, the 5 pairs I have, 4 were perfect and 1 had some small poor craftsmanship issues on one of the trees (chipped wood). All in all, when shopping for the discounted brand you can't expect perfection. Considering these work well, I think it's a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kenneth Perlstein

customer_reviews.title: Very nice shoe tree
customer_reviews.text: This looks identical to trees that I purchased at Men's Wearhouse a few years ago, absent the little plates. It stands apart because it has that good, strong cedar aroma. I don't like cedar to overpower my skivvies, but it's very useful on my shoes. The tree's design stretches the bridge of the shoe (the wide part) and stretches the heel, so the shoe is easier to don. The price is reasonable, and it arrived in a sturdy cardboard box suitable for gift wrapping if desired (that was packed into an Amazon box). These are a must-have for any man with a wide foot who owns dress shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Ilovemath

customer_reviews.title: Well made but small.
customer_reviews.text: These shoe trees are well made but smaller than labeled. I wear a size 13 shoe and had to send back the two pair that I ordered that were advertised to fit. Order a size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Monahan

customer_reviews.title: The construction is otherwise very nice as is the price
customer_reviews.text: Two minor complaints. The first complaint, which is not that big of a deal, but it might be with softer leather, is the odd shaped heal. It causes the top portion of the shoe above the heal to curve at a sharp angle. The second is that the toe could to a little further into the shoe. But, in the end, I plan on buying three more pair. The construction is otherwise very nice as is the price.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great cedar smell.
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with these for the price. I ordered size large and they fit my size 10 red wing work boots and size 9 iron rangers, although they fit pretty tight in the iron rangers. They have a few rough spots that needed smoothing out but not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs better quality control
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how much of the cedar is machine cut and how much is hand sanded -- but one of my pair was about 1/2" longer and more pointed than the other. Overall quality seems about average. So-so rivets. Heel portion could have a bit blunter back to avoid stretching the heel out of shape. We own a few dozen shoe trees -- haven't really found anything outstanding to recommend except some older wooden ones made along the same general design of these, but with better hardware and finishing.
customer_reviews.author: P & B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: I always wear out my dress shoes after just a few months. I recently went into business for myself and wanted to make sure that my Claiborne shoes stayed looking sharp. These have a great cedar smell to them, and have a high quality for the price. I will purchase these again when the time comes for additional pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Ty Warren

customer_reviews.title: Very nicely built, I recommend this product but be careful with the sizes.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: They are very nicely made. The wood is amazing, the metal is strong and it fits the shoe nicely. I am really happy with the product. Con: My shoe size is a size US men's 13. The X-Large size that I purchased is said to be sizes 11 to 13 but the 13 is a bit loose. For them to fit in snuggly, using the spring inside, I think the size should be rated 11 to 12 and the XX-Large being 13 and up. So if you are a size 13 I suggest going up a size to the XX-Large.
customer_reviews.author: APresto

customer_reviews.title: Fit well and work.
customer_reviews.text: I use these every night in the leather dress shoes I wear to work. In using them, my shoes have remained odor free and have retained their shape in the uppers as well. I wear a 9.5 Wide and these fit in great.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: makes these shoes trees my favorite, just because they are slightly more practical than ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoe trees for my Allen Edmond (AE) shoes. I found these were cheaper in price than the ones sold by AE, so I thought I'd give them a try. They work exactly the same as any high quality cedar shoe tree. The split toe makes the width more flexible for wider shoes. The tiny detail of having a rope to hold when pulling them out of your shoe, makes these shoes trees my favorite, just because they are slightly more practical than my more expensive AE shoe trees. They also fit perfectly. You should buy these without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Aluqman

customer_reviews.title: makes it easy to polish and maintain leather shoes
customer_reviews.text: decent quality, makes it easy to polish and maintain leather shoes. I bought these 7 years ago and still buy them. The cedar also eliminates moisture and makes my shoe drawer smell good like a mini cedar closet! My older shoes don't show many creases and are easy to use shoe cream and "hydrate" them. Not many scuffs on them due to these.
customer_reviews.author: James J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to and does it well.
customer_reviews.text: Shoe tree is well shaped, wood quality is excellent, spring tension is just right for the size (my large size trees fit everything from 10-11.5), and fit and finish is great for the price. Bottom line? Spending an extra 20 bucks to keep your shoes looking and smelling good (and making them last longer) is a no brainer. Go for it, you'll be glad you did. I think this is a well-known tip but I'll throw it out there anyway; sand your trees once in a while to expose new cedar to make sure it continues to work like new.
customer_reviews.author: Addison Bye

customer_reviews.title: It's funny. Amazon is asking if I can wear these ...
customer_reviews.text: It's funny. Amazon is asking if I can wear these comfortably and provide good arch support. LOLOL! This shoe tree fits my boots and other shoes quite well. I wear a women's size 11 and this works just fine. The toe part is split so the width is somewhat adjustable. I also love the cedar smell. I'll be buying more as my budget allows. These work great to keep leather shoes and boots in their proper form.
customer_reviews.author: T. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Value purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this shoetree for a few months now. Still smells fresh, springs are firm and I've seen no splintering yet (I'll update this if anything changes). Compared to brand name shoe trees, I think Woodlore keeps up with the best of 'em. This brand is also owned by Allen Edmonds as well. Great buy, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: JY

customer_reviews.title: wonderful
customer_reviews.text: i usually wear 12.5-13.5 and these fit perfectly due to the fact that they are very adjustable. even with my shoe size being on the larger end of what these shoe trees cover, they fill the shoe well with enough tension to keep the shoe shape well. unlike many shoe trees that i have seen, these not only adjust lengthwise but also for width. additionally, the cedar smell is wonderful and doesnt leave any dust or chips/slivers in my shoes. TL;DR: i would definitely recommend these, and i will be buying more as i buy more pairs of dress shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: A very nice tree.
customer_reviews.text: This is a shoe tree. It does not need arch support. I have several of them now. Great product. Fits well.
customer_reviews.author: Korak

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Prompt shipment and excellent quality. I ordered a medium for a man's 9.5 wide shoe and it's a little loose. Next time I'll order a large but it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: BobE

customer_reviews.title: These are NOT shoes. They are shoe trees. ...
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT shoes. They are shoe trees. I know your followup is computer generated, but someone needs to instruct your computer that there is a difference between shoe trees and shoes. I know they both contain the word shoe, but they are different. Therefore, I cannot wear these shoe trees. They do not fit well, nor do they provide arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Richards

customer_reviews.title: I would buy them again
customer_reviews.text: These fit great in my pair of dress shoes. They don't stretch them out but keep them a great shape and smelling fresh. I use them to store my shoes in the closet but also to travel when I pack the shoes. It keeps them from getting crush/creased. They easy to use and seem heavy duty. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Birfield85

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than the competitors, but really necessary? Maybe.
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a nicer pair of dress shoes, so I decided to splurge and get a set of Cedar Shoe Trees for them. After looking through the options on Amazon, Woodlore seemed to offer the cheapest of the well reviewed products. Overall, I thought these worked fine. They fit my size 8.5 shoes perfectly, and they had a pretty strong scent of cedar even after a week of use. i will update the review as necessary, but so far I am enjoying my product. I'm just not sure that anything >$10 should be necessary to keep the shape and maintain your shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Tsai

customer_reviews.title: I find them to be a great way to preserve my shoes
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased several pairs now of the Woodlore shoe trees. I find them to be a great way to preserve my shoes, especially athletic shoes. As a professional sports official, my shoes need to stay in shape and keep looking sharp. These guys do a great job. They wick the excess moisture from the shoes as soon as I take them off and they help the toe box maintain a comfortable (and properly formed) shape. In terms of size, I like the shoe trees to fit snug, in fact a little tight, to work best. My shoes are size 13, so the size XXL hits the bull's eye.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin F

customer_reviews.title: These are in all of my dress shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are great for maintaining the shape of all of my dress shoes and the cedar is very aromatic.
customer_reviews.author: ColorNerdChris

customer_reviews.title: When the shoe fits...
customer_reviews.text: Take care of it. I've never had a shoe tree before. It's awesome. As time passes my feet have gotten wider. This means my long time shoes need a little help ( I have a bunion on one foot) for me to keep enjoying them. These Woodlore Adjustable Shoe Trees seem to be made well, especially compared to a plastic counterpart. It makes cleaning and appreciating my shoes easier, plus the cedar helps shoes smell good. I've already bought another shoe tree for a pair of lovely boots. Take care of your shoes so they take care of you.
customer_reviews.author: CLH

customer_reviews.title: How did I go so long without buying these?!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pairs and I will go about buying a few more. They work great, fit great, and do an amazing job of keeping the shape of the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: L. Mateo

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected. I put these shoe trees in ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. I put these shoe trees in all of my dress shoes to maintain their shape.These shoe trees fit about 95% of my shoes but for some reason do not fit several of them as these were too big. I had to resort to purchasing a size down for the shoes that didn't fit this particular brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tango

customer_reviews.title: Solid, budget friendly shoe tree with expanding toe.
customer_reviews.text: Great item, it's the best value option at the moment if you only want one pair of trees, and is solidly built so it should last a long time. The mechanism inside is cool; pushing up on the connecting rod spreads the toes apart with a spring so it applies a decent force expanding the toe, while not forcing it to a certain shape. This combined with regular conditioning will minimize most creases in good leather.
customer_reviews.author: NShi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for my size 12 dogs
customer_reviews.text: Was never a shoe tree guy until I bought my first pair of $200 Johnson & Murphys. Took the advice of my shoe shine guy near the job and never turned back. The shoe trees have kept the leather wrinkle free since purchased 4 months ago on these shoes worn 3x per week. The cedar keeps tme smelling freshhhhhhh! Perfect fit for my size 12 dogs.
customer_reviews.author: 1LuvEvryTime

customer_reviews.title: Woodlore Shoe Trees
customer_reviews.text: I have noticed that the amount of money it takes for a decent pair of men's shoes these days is very high. One of the tips I learned as a young man was to use shoe trees to extend the life of your shoes. Yes indeed, these are effective in doing that. In addition, you can use them to "fill out" the shoe during polishing. Add the benefit of odor removal and you have a number of reasons to buy these. They fit as advertised and work as I described. I recommend them to anyone wanting to extend the life of their shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shoe tree for the price! I WILL be buying more.
customer_reviews.text: I really really like this shoe tree! This is the first one I have bought after my friend told me how great they were. Just like my first pair (from a different brand), they smell AMAZING (cedar is the best) and really hold the shape of my dress shoes well. The fit was perfect, and the spring in the arch helps lock them into place. I see no need to get a more expensive brand when these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: djlovell

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to compare these to the shoe trees from Jos. A. Bank since those seem to be the most popular. I like this much more than I do JAB shoe trees. They are going to run you about the same price, but the split toe is a much better design. I have a half dozen and haven't had any problems with them. They all arrived smooth and there weren't any chips in the wood.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Shoe Tree Options. Cedar or Bust!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe trees at a reasonable price. After all, if it is not cedar you should not buy it! Non cedar shoe trees cost nearly the same but are 80% less effective than these ones here. Biggest plus compared to all other cedar shoe trees is the pull tab at the end. $20 is a fair price and is slightly less expensive than some other retailers (some charge $25-$30!). HOWEVER, you can find a comparable pair of Woodlore shoe trees at Nordstroms Rack for $10.
customer_reviews.author: B Woon

customer_reviews.title: My husband has very wide feet, so I was ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband has very wide feet, so I was, initially, a little concerned about whether these would fit well inside his shoes. They have worked out quite well, and he has a set for each pair of his boots. They allow enough air movement that his boots don't get musty and smelly, and help keep them from getting crushed in the closet. I wouldn't say that the cedar is fragrant, at all, even after a light sanding, but that wasn't a high priority for him.
customer_reviews.author: arduous

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for a very heavy cedar scent you might be disappointed. The wood has a very subtle odor that's ...
customer_reviews.text: Currently use these in my AE Carlyle shoes. The fit is as expected and very snug. If you're looking for a very heavy cedar scent you might be disappointed. The wood has a very subtle odor that's not overpowering, which is good for me since I don't want my closet smelling like a workshop (leave that to the garage).
customer_reviews.author: P3NGU1N

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done. My shoes are a size 12, so I ordered the 11.5 - 13. It fits, but just barely. If you are right on the line of the size range, you probably want to go with the smaller size. Also, they do have a rather strong (presumably natural) cedar smell to them. I'm not particularly fond of that, but that is just me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this shoe tree because Amazon was out of ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe tree because Amazon was out of Johnston & Murphy shoe trees. The expandable spring tension is a little gritty and not nearly as smooth as the Johnston & Murphy ones. It does the job though.
customer_reviews.author: John Danley

customer_reviews.title: couldn't squeeze these into my shoes
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't put my large-size shoe trees in my size 10 1/2 Clark's shoes without a big struggle....here's my diagnosis as I compare these to my old Nordstrom shoe trees: not as smooth and polished as my Nordstrom shoe trees.... the shape seems a little bit off in the back such that it's difficult to comfortably put it in the back of the shoe....therefore I have to return these.
customer_reviews.author: D. Michael

customer_reviews.title: Put these in your shoes
customer_reviews.text: If you have good shoes, you should have shoe trees. These keep your shoes' shape and prevent them from smelling too bad. They do not put themselves into your shoes. You need to manually insert them into your shoes for them to do their job. They are made of cedar and will absorb shoe odor. Every so often, you can quickly buff them with a fine-grain sheet of sandpaper to freshen the scent. The pull-tab is useful for removing the shoe tree from your shoe.
customer_reviews.author: M. Baron

customer_reviews.title: Good... for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I wonder what part of the Lore of Wood says to leave splintered wood on the shoe tree? I guess I shouldn't expect much from one of the cheapest variants on Amazon. Regardless of that slightly annoying thorn in my toe (heh) these fit well and their mechanisms work.
customer_reviews.author: David-and-Chaslin

customer_reviews.title: So good I'm buying more!
customer_reviews.text: These cedar shoe trees fit my 9.5 D-width Allen Edmonds quite well. Takes a little effort to get them out, but I have already seen it "fix" a few months worth of damage I did by not using these from the get go. Highly recommended. In fact, I just ordered more shoes, so I need to go buy another set of these...
customer_reviews.author: Jeff SU

customer_reviews.title: Love this product.
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. It fits great for many shoe sizes. And keeps your shoes looking nice and good. They also smell really good. I have been using them for 3 years now and always buy more when I need them. They also work great when you need to polish your shoes or clean them by hand.
customer_reviews.author: chad laumann

customer_reviews.title: A bit pricey but well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Very quick and simple review here: These go in your shoes. If the tree costs more than the shoes, maybe skip this. Otherwise, this will keep your expensive dress shoes from turning into floppy baseball mits. Feet stink. Shoes stink. Shoes which are stored with cedar stink not. If the cedar stops producing that lovely masculine scent, sand it up a bit with some fine grit sand paper and enjoy the return of natures perfume.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Taheri

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: These are an exceptional value, and have nearly transformed the look of some of my regularly worn dress shoes to like-new shape. I use the 6 - 7.5 M US size for my 7.5 size shoes, and they do a great job. My only complaint is that they are a bit too heavy for travel. This obviously isn't the purpose of this product, but it is something to keep in mind if you're as anal as I am about maintaining shoe conditioning while on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Mirateck

customer_reviews.title: Doing it's job!
customer_reviews.text: I bought three different brands (Woodlore, Foot Fitter, and Cedar Elements), and Woodlore came in #2 (though it came close to #1). Spring definitely provides the tension and it fits wonderfully in the shoe. However, I'm not a fan of the handle as it doesn't conform as nicely to the back angle are (as compared to the Cedar Elements one).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe Trees!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought these--they are crafted beautifully, clever designed, and the aroma from the cedar is wonderful. Full disclosure: I have never purchased wooden shoe trees before (only the cheaper plastic kind for travel), so in all honesty I cannot compare these to other brands. However the price point was somewhat below comparable products and yet the quality is top-notch (and made in USA, which is refreshing). Bottom-line I am delighted with the 3 pairs I bought for some of my nicer work shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Clan Gardner

customer_reviews.title: these seem pretty poorly constructed compared to every other set of shoe ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the nails came out after using it a few times and so it falls apart. I might be able to repair it. But overall, these seem pretty poorly constructed compared to every other set of shoe trees I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: B. Aho

customer_reviews.title: Great for odor elimination, minimizing creases, keeping shoe shape
customer_reviews.text: These have completely eliminated the odor from my dress shoes, and have helped decrease the wrinkles. I wear a size 9.5, and these are the perfect size to keep the form of the shoe, and to help minimize creases. I have 4 pairs of these for all of my leather shoes, they are really an essential item.
customer_reviews.author: Tim P

customer_reviews.title: Fits my size 7.5 shoes!
customer_reviews.text: As I have ridiculously small feet, my shoes are typically US 7 or 7.5. Often shoe trees are too long to fit - especially in dress shoes that have a narrower toe. These "fully" adjustable trees fit well in my US 7.5 Oxfords. I knocked one star off because they did NOT fit readily in my US 7.5 AE Dalton boots. With enough force they fit but I haven't been doing that as I worry about stretching or ripping the stitching. I'm not really sure what the solution is in this case other than to buy a "large" Boy's size shoe tree. Sigh.
customer_reviews.author: ChickenBeard

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT fit sizes 6-6.5
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 6.5, and although this is supposed to fit sizes 6-7.5 it's virtually impossible for me to fit these into my shoes. After about 25 minutes and my husband's brute force, these finally fit into my shoes (of course when I took them out to wear the shoe, we had to go through the trouble of getting them in all over again - not worth it) ...I've ordered a different model in size XS - hopefully those actually fit.
customer_reviews.author: CdotTaylor

customer_reviews.title: Great Cedar Shoe Keeper
customer_reviews.text: I got a couple of pairs of these for my work shoes. I work on my feet all day. I keep two pair of shoes at work so that I can alternate the pair I wear every other day. I put these cedar shoe keepers in the shoes when I'm not wearing them. The shoe keepers keep my shoes stretched out instead of allowing them to curl. They make my shoes last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Dierk Sr.

customer_reviews.title: The Ones You Need
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 3 pairs of these over the years. They're what you need to keep your shoes in good shape for years. I've tried other models that we're difficult to remove from the shoe and these are no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C

customer_reviews.title: Replaced These with Stratton Brand
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT Allen Edmonds. The backs are too narrow/sharp. They are cutting in to the backs of my shoes...spend the extra $10 and get a reputable pair. I replaced these with Stratton Branded Shoe Trees. I am pleased with the Stratton’s.
customer_reviews.author: T

product_meta.title: Woodlore Adjustable Men's Shoe Tree Pair
product_meta.description:
The Adjustable Shoe tree has split-toe design with a spreader plate that adjusts to a complete range of shoe widths. Made with steel hardware and nylon straps. Continual use of cedar shoe trees prolongs the life of shoes. Sold in pairs and also available in women's sizes. All Woodlore shoe trees are made with 75% or more of the heartwood which is where the aromatic qualities are and come with a lifetime warranty against mechanical defects. After time, lightly sand the cedar to rejuvenate its fresh scent.

Help protect your footwear investment with this Woodlore shoe tree. Made from cedar in a design that can be adjusted for length and toe width, it absorbs moisture naturally while keeping your shoe in the perfect shape.

Founded in 1922, Allen-Edmonds Shoe Corporation manufactures premium men's footwear, accessories, and cedar products using the philosophy of quality, service and integrity. Taking shoemaking to the level of an art form, each pair of Allen-Edmonds shoes are carefully crafted by hand in a process that includes 212 separate production steps. No detail is too small, because supreme quality is the cornerstone of the Allen-Edmonds name.

See more
feature_bullets: Best quality shoe trees are made of US aromatic cedar
All natural cedar absorbs moisture from shoes
Cedar shoes trees deodorize shoes with its fresh scent
Cedar shoe trees prevent cracks and creases in leather
